column4: currently I am using ubuntu 11.04, is there any way I can downgrade it to 10.10 without formatting my Hard Disk
In other words, you can't downgrade. Just backup /home/rahul/ and /etc/
You don't have to -- but it won't hurt. It's only 10MB at most. Your systemwide settings.
/etc/apt/sources.list (and among many things) are under /etc/ -- Sometimes we make changes and forget to keep them.
Necessary or not. It's an option. I mean, you don't have to back up your home directory too. -- But you want to. It's up to you.
Wow. Back them up. I generally keep hard drives separated so reinstalling any OS is relatively easy for me. :)
Meanwhile, use 11.04 until you have something in place. I guess. I'd recommend you to use multiple hard drives as to keep OS and 150GB~ data of personal consumption separated. :)
Dun dun dun. Try other themes. I don't think that's the theme you wanted.
I use compiz. Unsure about metacity. You should do this -- "sudo apt-get install gnome-colors" for icons.
I'm not using Ubuntu -- but I'm using Gnome.
I like giving out candies and supports.
